content.description: Starts on a good left hand crimp about 6 feets off the ground and flat right hand down and to the right on the backside of the boulder. Goes up and left to finish into what I believe is Back 9. Not sure if this has been previously established. but I did it in a couple tries today (10/15/2020) and the grade is an estimate. Refer to the picture for the start holds.
content.location: Starts near the center of the backside of the boulder.

content.description: Start on the two opposing Gaston rails and climb up on the face then upper portion of the left arete.
content.location: Main face on the low side of the boulder close to the trail.

climbs.name: One of the best, last, unclimbable climbs

content.description: Start on rail then move up to opposing side pull pinches and a big finish. Â Avoid going right.
content.location: The center of the front side as you approach the boulder.

content.description:
High-ball Located on the tall face you see as you approach the boulder from the road.  Towards the right side of the face their is a large arete feature. Route climbs directly up the slab face just right of the arete feature.

Easy mantle onto a ledge leads to finding the proper feet for a very committing layback move to gain a flat hold at the lip of the boulder.

Fun movement but don't fall on the top half due to ledge.
content.location: Located on tall face of boulder located 50 yards up the trail.

content.description: Stand start on crimps directly under the top out for back 9. Head straight up on solid crimps and top out with a tricky mantle.
content.location: Located on the backside of the large boulder 50 yards up the trail.

content.description: Moves up delicately through sold gray limestone. Cool grips on the top section.
content.location: Located on the backside arete of the large boulder 50 yards up the trail. Starts on a large jug sloper and moves up and onto the right face.
